channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Maximo Asset Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Maximo Asset Management

item.title: CVE-2019-4429|2024-08-04T19:33:38.284Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 162886.

item.title: CVE-2020-4526|2024-08-04T08:07:48.904Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery which could allow an attacker to execute malicious and unauthorized actions transmitted from a user that the website trusts. IBM X-Force ID: 182436.

item.title: CVE-2019-4644|2024-08-04T19:40:47.976Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 170880.

item.title: CVE-2019-4430|2024-08-04T19:33:37.944Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 162887.

item.title: CVE-2019-4056|2024-08-04T19:26:27.951Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 Work Centers' application does not validate file type upon upload, allowing attackers to upload malicious files. IBM X-Force ID: 156565.

item.title: CVE-2019-4478|2024-08-04T19:33:38.159Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0, and 7.6.1 could allow an authenticated user to obtain highly sensitive information that they should not normally have access to. IBM X-Force ID: 163998.

item.title: CVE-2019-4671|2024-08-04T19:40:48.941Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. IBM X-Force ID: 171437.

item.title: CVE-2019-4512|2024-08-04T19:40:47.303Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1 generates an error message that includes sensitive information that could be used in further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 164554.

item.title: CVE-2020-4463|2024-08-04T08:07:48.747Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0.1 and 7.6.0.2 is vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 181484.

item.title: CVE-2019-4048|2024-08-04T19:26:27.989Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 could allow a physical user of the system to obtain sensitive information from a previous user of the same machine. IBM X-Force ID: 156311.

item.title: CVE-2020-4529|2024-08-04T08:07:48.910Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is vulnerable to server side request forgery (SSRF). This may allow an authenticated attacker to send unauthorized requests from the system, potentially leading to network enumeration or facilitating other attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 182713.

item.title: CVE-2020-4223|2024-08-04T08:00:07.102Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0.10 and 7.6.1.1 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 175121.

item.title: CVE-2021-38935|2024-08-04T01:51:20.910Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.2 does not require that users should have strong passwords by default, which makes it easier for attackers to compromise user accounts. IBM X-Force ID: 210892.

item.title: CVE-2019-4745|2024-08-04T19:40:48.963Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.0 could allow a remote attacker to disclose sensitive information to an authenticated user due to disclosing path information in the URL. IBM X-Force ID: 172883.

item.title: CVE-2019-4530|2024-08-04T19:40:47.298Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6, 7.6.1, and 7.6.1.1 could allow an authenticated user to delete a record that they should not normally be able to. IBM X-Force ID: 165586.

item.title: CVE-2019-4364|2024-08-04T19:33:37.971Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 is vulnerable to CSV injection, which could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbirary commands on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 161680.

item.title: CVE-2020-4409|2024-08-04T08:00:07.648Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, using a tabnabbing attack. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive information or conduct further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 179537.

item.title: CVE-2019-4749|2024-08-04T19:40:49.060Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 173308.

item.title: CVE-2020-4521|2024-08-04T08:07:49.003Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an unsafe deserialization in Java. By sending specially-crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 182396.

item.title: CVE-2019-4446|2024-08-04T19:33:38.016Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 could allow an authenticated user perform actions they are not authorized to by modifying request parameters. IBM X-Force ID: 163490.

item.title: CVE-2019-4591|2024-08-04T19:40:47.351Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 does not invalidate session after logout which could allow a local user to impersonate another user on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 167451.

item.title: CVE-2019-4582|2024-08-04T19:40:47.617Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 167288.

item.title: CVE-2019-4583|2024-08-04T19:40:48.403Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0.10 and 7.6.1.1 could allow an authenticated user to obtain sensitive information from a stack trace that could be used to aid future attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 167289.

item.title: CVE-2021-38924|2024-08-04T01:51:20.758Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1 and 7.6.1.2 could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information when a detailed technical error message is returned in the browser. This information could be used in further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 210163.

item.title: CVE-2020-4493|2024-08-04T08:07:48.891Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 could allow an attacker to bypass authentication and issue commands using a specially crafted HTTP command. IBM X-Force ID: 181995.

item.title: CVE-2019-4486|2024-08-04T19:40:47.470Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 164070.

item.title: CVE-2019-4303|2024-08-04T19:33:38.047Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 160949.

item.title: CVE-2019-4650|2024-08-04T19:40:48.180Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1 is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. IBM X-Force ID: 170961.

item.title: CVE-2023-38723|2024-08-02T17:46:56.799Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Application Suite 7.6.1.3 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 262192.

item.title: CVE-2024-27266|2024-08-02T00:28:00.241Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Application Suite 7.6.1.3 is vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 284566.

item.title: CVE-2024-27266|2024-03-14T18:32:28.919Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Application Suite 7.6.1.3 is vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 284566.

IBM X-Force ID: 262192.
